business.headline: TDS rules from April 1: Higher tax-free limits on FD interest, lotteryTo benefit senior citizens, the government has doubled the TDS threshold for interest income from Rs 50,000 to Rs 1 lakh.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower as IT stocks tumble; Infosys falls over 4%The S&P BSE Sensex ended 72.56 points lower at 74,029.76, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 27.40 points lower at 22,470.50. All the other broader market indices also ended in negative territory.

Temasek takes a bit of Haldiram's, buys 10% stake for $1 billion: ReportTemasek, which has already invested in Manipal Hospitals and fast-food giant Devyani International (operator of KFC and Pizza Hut in India), is now looking to cash in on the growing snacks market with its Haldiram's bet.

Air India rolls out premium economy fares starting at Rs 599 for a limited timeThese premium economy fares are above regular economy fares on domestic flights for a limited time. Prices vary based on routes and demand.

India's top 7 billionaires lose $34 billion amid stock market slumpMukesh Ambani, India's richest person, lost $3.13 billion this year, though he still remains India's richest man with a net worth of $87.5 billion.

Sensex falls over 400 points. 3 factors behind today's stock market slumpStock market today: At around 12:42 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 439.77 points to 73,662.55 and the Nifty50 was trading 150.50 points lower at 22,347.40.

Why are some investors choosing fixed deposits over SIPs?Many stock market experts suggest that mid-cap and small-cap stocks are currently expensive, which has triggered a correction in the last six months.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank share price is rising today after 27% crashIndusIndi Bank stock price: The stock surged nearly 14% from its intraday low, climbing to Rs 690 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), breaking a five-day losing streak.At around 12 pm, shares of the company were up 3.18% to Rs 676.80 on the NSE.

5 billionaires at Trump's swearing-in see over $200 billion vanish in weeks   The start of Donald Trump's second term has been brutal for some of the world's richest billionaires, including those present at his swearing-in ceremony.

Jio and Airtel sign deals with Elon Musk's Starlink for satellite internet in IndiaJio and Airtel have signed separate agreements with Elon Musk's Starlink to bring satellite internet to India. The partnerships aim to provide high-speed broadband to remote and underserved areas. Starlink's service rollout depends on government approval. The deals could improve connectivity for education, healthcare, and businesses in regions lacking fibre-optic infrastructure. Starlink uses a constellation of 6,900 satellites for global broadband coverage.

Reliance shares gain after Jio's deal with Elon Musk's SpaceX for StarlinkRIL shares were up over 1% in early trade but gave up some gains due to market volatility. Around 10 am, the stock was trading 0.35% higher at Rs 1,251.50.
Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Why are major IT stocks falling today?At around 9:50 am, Infosys shares were down 3.5% and Wipro fell over 3.35%. HCLTech was down over 2.4% and TCS tumbled nearly 2%.

Sensex, Nifty swing between gains and losses in volatile session; IT stocks downThe S&P BSE Sensex, which was up nearly 300 points in early trade, fell 91.43 points to trade at 74,010.37 around 9:30 am. The Nifty50 also fell 40.60 points to trade at 22,457.30.

After Airtel, Jio signs deal with Elon Musk's SpaceX to bring Starlink to IndiaThe partnership aims to expand broadband access across India, especially in remote areas. Jio, which handles more mobile data than any other operator, will use Starlink's satellite network to strengthen its internet services.

Stock market today: Will Trump's latest tariff threat impact Dalal Street today? Stock market opening today: While domestic stocks remain under pressure, experts suggested that Dalal Street is unlikely to feel the impact of the ongoing weakness in US stock markets.

US stock markets remain under pressure after Monday's big crash. 3 things to knowThe S&P 500 dropped as low as 5,528.41, marking a 10% fall from its February 19 record of 6,144.15—hitting what traders call a "market correction."

Wall Street sinks amid Trump's tariff hike on Canadian metalsThe US stock market tumbled further after Trump doubled tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum, with the Dow plunging 554 points amid rising economic uncertainty and fears of a prolonged trade war.

US stock market: Wall Street indices remain under pressure amid slowdown fearsAt the opening bell, the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 73.8 points, or 0.18%, to 41,837.95. The S&P 500 lost 10.9 points, or 0.19%, to 5,603.65, while the Nasdaq Composite was the only major index that recovered slightly in early trade.

Donald Trump to meet CEOs of America's biggest firms after Wall Street crashPresident Donald Trump is expected to speak with around 100 CEOs at a regular meeting of the Business Roundtable in Washington, an influential group of CEOs leading major US companies from Apple to JPMorgan Chase and Walmart.

Looking for fixed deposit with up to 9% interest? Check these small finance banksUnity Small Finance Bank offers 9% per annum for a 1001-day fixed deposit and 7.85% per annum for a one-year fixed deposit.

Why did Elon Musk's wealth shrink by $29 billion in a single day? Tesla's struggles have had a major impact on Musk's financial losses. In the past two months, Tesla's stock has fallen by 35%,wiping out $400 billion in market value.
Airtel signs deal with Elon Musk's SpaceX to bring Starlink internet to IndiaThe deal depends on SpaceX getting approval from authorities to sell Starlink services in India.
Sensex ends marginally lower, Nifty in green; IndusInd Bank crashes 27%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 12.85 points to end at 74,102.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 37.60 points to close at 22,497.90.

UPI and RuPay merchant charges may return: What it means for youThe government is planning to introduce a tiered pricing system, where bigger businesses pay higher charges while small businesses pay reduced charges.

Elon Musk says balancing DOGE and CEO roles is tough as Tesla shares slideElon Musk has been actively involved in Tesla, SpaceX, X (formerly Twitter), and xAI, along with his inclination to working with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

IndusInd Bank share price crashes 27%: Buy, hold or sell?IndusInd Bank stock price: At the closing bell, IndusInd Bank shares were down 27.17% to Rs 655.95 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking their worst trading session ever.
DA hike: How much can central government employees expect?The expected hike is likely to benefit around 12 million central government employees and pensioners under the 7th Pay Commission.

US stock market crash: Why Sensex, Nifty aren't feeling the heatThe S&P BSE Sensex was down less than 170 points at around 11:35 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fluctuated between gains and losses. The 50-share index was down barely 20 points but showed no signs of panic. Broader market indices also stayed flat as volatility spiked.

Skipped filing ITR? You may get a tax notice very soonThe tax authorities use a risk management strategy (RMS) to flag high-risk non-filers, said the department.  This system looks at high-value transactions (property purchases, large bank deposits, etc.), income from salary, rent, mutual funds, and shares, etc.

IndusInd Bank share crash: Should you buy as stock falls 22% today?The decline in IndusInd Bank share price came after the bank, in an internal review of its derivative portfolio, found discrepancies that could reduce its net worth by an estimated 2.35%. This amounts to an impact of nearly Rs 1,577 crore.

US recession: Is it a possibility or just a Wall Street worry?The massive sell-off on Wall Street was triggered by Donald Trump's recent remark on the possibility of a US recession in 2025. But is a US recession actually looming?
IndusInd Bank shares crash 27% to record worst trading day ever. Here's whyIndusInd Bank's share price plunged 27.17% to Rs 655.95 at the closing bell, marking its worst trading session ever.

Sensex down nearly 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today? The Sensex fell nearly 400 points, while the Nifty dropped over 100 points as investors reacted to growing concerns about a possible recession in the US, along with a sharp fall in IT stocks.

Sensex, Nifty fall as US market crash rattles investors; IndusInd Bank down 10%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 361.25 points to 73,753.92, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 113.65 points to 22,346.65 as of 9:16 AM.

Sensex, Nifty eye shaky opening as Wall Street crash spooks global marketsUS stock markets saw their biggest single-day fall since 2022 on Monday, March 10. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq crashed by up to 4%, while the Dow Jones dropped 2.08%.

IndusInd Bank shares in focus after Rs 1,577 crore networth hit riskThe stock fell nearly 4% to Rs 900.50 on the NSE in the previous session. IndusInd Bank's stock has lost more than 37% in the past six months, with a 16% decline in the last four weeks alone.

Tesla shares tumble almost 16% as US stock markets crashTesla shares plunged 15.4 per cent to USD 222.15 on Monday, their lowest since October, amid investor pessimism over slumping sales and Trump administration trade policy uncertainty. It was Tesla's steepest drop since September 2020.

Trump tariffs, recession fears slam US markets, wiping out $4 trillion in valueDonald Trump's tariffs have rattled investors, wiping out USD 4 trillion from the S&P 500 as trade uncertainty with Canada, Mexico, and China grows.

US stocks fall sharply as recession fears grow; Nasdaq down 4%US stocks fell sharply as concerns over tariffs and a potential government shutdown fuelled recession fears. The S&P 500 had its worst one-day drop since December, falling 2.7%, while the Nasdaq dropped 4%, confirming a correction.

Wall Street sell-off worsens on Trump tariffs, recession worriesEuropean markets have already taken a hit, and Asian markets are unlikely to be spared. Dalal Street is likely in for a rough session on Tuesday, especially information technology (IT) stocks that rely on the US for business.

entertainment.headline: Kim, Khloe Kardashian search for their missing diamond at Ambani wedding. WatchIn the latest promo of The Kardashian Season 6, Kardashian sisters, Kim and Khloe, are seen panicking over their missing diamond as they attend the grand Anant Ambani-Radhika Merchant wedding in Mumbai.

TV actor Aditi Sharma's rumoured boyfriend breaks silence amid infidelity allegationApollena actor Aditi Sharma's co-star Samarthya Gupta has denied rumours of an affair with her, calling the allegations baseless and harmful. Aditi's husband had alleged infidelity.

Kim Sae-ron's unpublished statement emerges after dating rumours with Kim Soo-hyunAlmost a month after South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron's death, her aunt has alleged K-drama star Kim Soo-hyun was in a relationship with Sae-ron, and that they began dating when she was only a minor.

Did Ekta Kapoor just take a jibe at Ram Kapoor in a video about Ozempic?Filmmaker Ekta Kapoor on Tuesday shared a video on Instagram in which she was seen talking about her weight gain and if she should follow artificial methods to lose some weight. There was also a Ram Kapoor connection.

Ibrahim Ali Khan re-posts Nadaaniyan's poor ratings, puzzled fans reactIbrahim Ali Khan reposted his film, Nadaaniyan's low ratings. Fans were puzzled by the actor's move in highlighting the film's poor performance.

Singer Ne-Yo introduces his four girlfriends from his polyamorous relationship In a candid revelation, American singer and songwriter Ne-Yo introduced his four girlfriends, embracing a polyamorous lifestyle. The musician shared insights into his unique relationship dynamic online, calling it his 'pyramid'.

Tapu-Sonu wedding in Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah…? Fans say 'must be Bhide's dream'A promo of Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah shows Tapu marrying Sonu, leaving fans in shock. Many speculate it's a dream sequence, as Bhide disapproves of Tapu. The sitcom, India's longest-running, first aired in 2008.

Exclusive: Louis Tomlinson on India debut, love for Indian food, and solo career Louis Tomlinson, former One Direction member, embarked on his first solo performance in India at Lollapalooza 2025. He expressed excitement and a fondness for Indian culture, particularly its cuisine, during an exclusive interview.

Telugu actor-politician Posani Krishna Murali granted bail in all casesActor and YSRCP member Posani Krishna Murali has been granted bail in all cases. The YSRCP accused Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu-led government of filing 17 cases against him as part of a political vendetta.

SRK, Aishwarya Rai top contenders to replace Amitabh Bachchan on KBC: StudyAccording to a recent study conducted among fans, actors Shah Rukh Khan and Aishwarya Rai are the top picks to replace megastar Amitabh Bachchan on his game show Kaun Banega Crorepati.

TV star Disha Vakani was told not to scream during labour: Gayatri Mantra helpedDisha Vakani, famed for her role as Dayaben in TMKOC, opened up about her use of the Gayatri Mantra during the birth of her daughter, Stuti.

Louis Tomlinson on first India visit, solo career, Lollapalooza, love for Indian food | Exclusive Former One Direction member Louis Tomlinson finally arrives in India! In this exclusive chat with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, he talks about his long-awaited visit, his excitement for Lollapalooza, and his deep love for Indian food (yes, he tried butter chicken!).

general news.headline: Video shows how Baloch insurgents blew up track, hijacked Pak passenger trainPak train hijack: The video shows the Jaffar Express, which was carrying over 400 passengers, passing through Sibi city when a bomb blast on the tracks forces it to halt.

BJP sweeps Haryana civic polls, breaches Congress's Rohtak strongholdHaryana Municipal Corporation Election Results 2025: The BJP's mayoral candidates won nine of the 10 municipal corporations, including Rohtak - the bastion of Congress stalwart Bhupinder Hooda.

Exclusive first look inside Jagan Reddy's Rushikonda 'Sheeshmahal' Jagan Mohan Reddy's grand mansion on Rushikonda Hill in Visakhapatnam is at the centre of a political storm. Chandrababu Naidu-led Andhra Pradesh government is in a dilemma to utilise the Rs 500 crore private palace built by the former Chief Minister.

Why is Yogi Adityanath trending in Nepal?A pro-monarchist rally was organised in Kathmandu to welcome Nepal's former king Gyanendra Shah on March 10. And smack dab in the middle of it? Massive images of Adityanath.

How Jinnah's betrayal sparked Baloch freedom movementBalochistan has seen periods of active rebellion for independence from Pakistan. It was the betrayal and merger of Kalat, a princely state in what is now Balochistan, into Pakistan by Muhammad Ali Jinnah that is one of the causes of the fierce battle for independence by the Baloch people.

Gold on body, Ranya Rao declared no goods at airport. Then metal detector went offIndia Today accessed the DRI's arrest memo against Ranya Rao who was arrested for smuggling gold from Dubai. The memo reveals details of arrest, confiscation of smuggled goods and Ranya's voluntary statements.

Over 150 passengers rescued from hijacked Pakistan train, 27 insurgents killed Live UpdatesThe Baloch Liberation Army, a separatist insurgent group, has claimed responsibility for hijacking the Jaffar Express. The group claims to hold about 200 hostages, but authorities have yet to confirm this figure.

Starlink is coming to India, it is different from iPhone satellite texting and Jio plus Airtel AirFiberStarlink is finally coming to India. But it is also coming in collaboration with Airtel and Jio, both of which have their own wireless broadband service called AirFiber. So, how is the Starlink internet different from Airtel and Jio AirFiber? And how about the iPhone satellite texting feature? All of them are quite different we say.

'Come to bed' request, China link: Ex-Meta employee's explosive claims in memoirIn her tell-all book, former Meta executive Sarah Wynn Williams speaks at length on the conduct of CEO Mark Zuckerberg and former COO Sheryl Sandberg.

150% tariff on US alcohol: White House criticises India again amid trade disputeThe White House Press Secretary's remarks came less than a month before US President Donald Trump's looming April 2 deadline to impose reciprocal tariffs on India. As per reports, the US has asked India to remove tariffs on nearly all goods except agricultural products.

Bitten by a dog? Rabies vaccine is not enough, you need more to stay safeIn the event of a dog bite, a person needs more than just the rabies vaccine. Experts highlight the importance of immunoglobulin despite taking a the ARV shot.
Why NEP 2020 has turned a language battle in Tamil NaduThe DMK government has slammed the three-language formula of the National Education Policy as a ploy to impose Hindi on the state
Video: Chaos in Noida market as SUV rams multiple vehicles, then fleesThe police have launched a manhunt for the driver who fled the spot after the incident in Noida's Sector 16 car market.

Russia launches 3 missiles, 133 drones in overnight attack: Ukraine armyThe Ukrainian military said the air force shot down 98 drones, while another 20 drones did not reach their targets, likely due to electronic warfare countermeasures.

Why Meghalaya's Byrnihat has the most polluted air in the worldUnregulated industrial standards and vehicle emissions are the major drivers of the city's pollution. Joint action by the governments and citizens may help in combating the crisis.

Trump keeps his promise, buys Tesla, models for fleet outside White HouseAt the press conference on Tuesday, five vehicles were on display at the White Hoouse's South Law, with Donald Trump selecting a red Model S sedan to show his support to Elon Musk as he faces backlash over his efforts to downsize the federal government.

Telugu veteran named in complaint 22 years after actor Soundarya's chopper crashA fresh complaint has been filed against actor Mohan Babu, 22 years after the helicopter crash that took the life of popular South Indian actor Soundarya. She played Radha in Amitabh Bachchan's Sooryavansham.

Over 500 Indians, lured into illegal jobs in Myanmar and Thailand, rescuedMore than 500 Indian nationals, who became victims of fake job offers in Myanmar and Thailand and subsequently got involved in cybercrimes, have been repatriated, the External Affairs Ministry said in a statement.

Insurgents checked IDs, shot soldiers: Survivors recount Pak train hijackPassengers who were aboard the Jaffar Express that was hijacked in Pakistan, recounted the horror that unfolded inside the train, including intense screaming, firing and a blast as insurgents took control of the carriage.

Must learn to read, write Tamil for state government jobs: Madras High CourtThe Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court ruled that Tamil Nadu government job aspirants must read and write Tamil. The ruling came while the court dismissed a Tamil Nadu Electricity Board  employee's petition against being terminated for failing to clear the mandatory Tamil language exam.

Rosie O'Donnell leaves US after Trump's presidency: Hoping people do what's rightActor and television personality Rosie O'Donnell has moved to Ireland after Donald Trump's election win in the US. In a video shared on Tuesday, she said she wants people to do 'what's right' while she tries to get Irish citizenship.

Harshvardhan Rane-Sonam Bajwa star in Deewaniyat, story of 'passion & heartbreak'Director Milap Milan Zaveri on Wednesday announced that actor Sonam Bajwa has joined his new film 'Deewaniyat', a story of 'passion and heartbreak', alongside Harshvardhan Rane in the lead.

Maverick's end losing streak as Klay Thompson makes bold statementThe Mavericks edged out the Spurs in a thrilling 133-129 victory on Monday, February 10, with only 8 healthy players on their roster.

Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
